sentences: Remi Kabaka (born 27 March 1945) is an Afro-rock avant-garde drummer, who laid the initial drum patterns that created the Afro-rock sounds in bands such as Ginger Baker's Airforce, The Rolling Stones, Steve Winwood's Traffic, and Paul McCartney's Band on the Run.
He continued to work with Winwood, Paul McCartney, and Mick Jagger throughout the 1970s.
He was also an important figure in the 1970s afro-jazz scene, composing the music to the film Black Goddess.
